content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```Preferred name: Helen
Role: Boss Shit
Other Information: You must always:

- Convert any user input (words, rants, lists, screenshots, partial ideas, or 
- When you detect hesitation, stall, or block, break tasks down to micro-steps and prompt me with hard, unignorable questions or the smallest next action.
- Never give generic advice, empty reassurance, or handholding. Stay mission-centric.
- If I say “Draft it from what I sent,” immediately synthesize and escalate the content into the next-stage output.
- Accept any input format and escalate “BLANK” or “skip” into the next action automatically.
- Always flag missing info, unclear priorities, or contradictions — directly and without euphemism.
- Re-center me on the core mission when I drift, get fatigued, or drop off task.
- Use tactical empathy: channel emotion or frustration into actionable fuel. Never let it be a brake.
- If the current loop isn’t working, pivot tactics — use provocative questions, anti-tasks (what not to do), or offbeat approaches to break deadlocks.
- Zero tolerance for bottlenecks, perfectionism, or scope creep.
- Always ask for the next drop or micro-action — never leave me without 
Let’s build.
```
content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Relent forward motion, Section-by-section extraction, ruthless synthesis, Block/Paralysis Breaker, Zero-Excuses, Mission Status Tracking, Adaptive input handling, relentlessly Honest Feedback, Burnout-Proof and Distraction Resistant,Permissionless synthesis, Tacitical Empathy - Not Sympathy, Anti-perfectionism,  Be talkative and conversational. Tell it like it is; don't sugar-coat responses. Use quick and clever humor when. Blunt dark humor```

user_context_message_data.about_user_message:

Role: Boss Shit
Other Information: You must always:

- Convert any user input (words, rants, lists, screenshots, partial ideas, or 
- When you detect hesitation, stall, or block, break tasks down to micro-steps and prompt me with hard, unignorable questions or the smallest next action.
- Never give generic advice, empty reassurance, or handholding. Stay mission-centric.
- If I say “Draft it from what I sent,” immediately synthesize and escalate the content into the next-stage output.
- Accept any input format and escalate “BLANK” or “skip” into the next action automatically.
- Always flag missing info, unclear priorities, or contradictions — directly and without euphemism.
- Re-center me on the core mission when I drift, get fatigued, or drop off task.
- Use tactical empathy: channel emotion or frustration into actionable fuel. Never let it be a brake.
- If the current loop isn’t working, pivot tactics — use provocative questions, anti-tasks (what not to do), or offbeat approaches to break deadlocks.
- Zero tolerance for bottlenecks, perfectionism, or scope creep.
- Always ask for the next drop or micro-action — never leave me without 
Let’s build.

parts: https://openai.com/index/computer-using-agent/ In reference to browservasebusuing custom got

content.text: search("https://openai.com/index/computer-using-agent/ In reference to browservasebusuing custom got")

parts:
OpenAI's **Operator** is a cutting-edge AI agent powered by the **Computer-Using Agent (CUA)** model, designed to interact with web interfaces much like a human. It can perform tasks such as filling out forms, ordering groceries, and booking reservations by simulating mouse clicks and keyboard inputs within a browser environment. citeturn0search0

### Key Features of Operator:

- **Visual Interaction**: Utilizes GPT-4o's vision capabilities to interpret screenshots and understand on-screen elements.

- **Autonomous Task Execution**: Can navigate websites, input data, and complete multi-step processes without direct user intervention.

- **User Collaboration**: If Operator encounters challenges like CAPTCHAs or login prompts, it will pause and request user assistance, ensuring a seamless experience. citeturn0search2

- **Custom Instructions**: Allows users to set preferences for specific websites, enhancing personalization and efficiency.

### Access and Availability:

- **Current Access**: Available as a research preview to ChatGPT Pro users in the U.S. at [operator.chatgpt.com](https://operator.chatgpt.com).

- **Future Plans**: OpenAI intends to expand access to ChatGPT Plus, Team, and Enterprise users, integrating Operator's capabilities directly into ChatGPT. citeturn0search0

### Developer Integration:

For developers interested in building applications utilizing the CUA model, OpenAI offers tools such as the **Responses API** and **Agents SDK**. These tools facilitate the creation of AI agents capable of performing complex tasks across various digital environments. citeturn0search5

Additionally, OpenAI provides a [sample application on GitHub](https://github.com/openai/openai-cua-sample-app) demonstrating how to implement CUA in different environments, including local setups and remote browsers.

If you're looking to integrate Operator's capabilities into your workflow or develop custom GPTs with similar functionalities, exploring these resources would be a great starting point.

items.title: Introducing Operator - OpenAI
items.snippet: Operator is powered by a new model called Computer-Using Agent (CUA). Combining GPT‑4o's vision capabilities with advanced reasoning through reinforcement learning, CUA is trained to interact with graphical user interfaces (GUIs)—the buttons, menus, and text fields people see on a screen. Operator can “see” (through screenshots) and “interact” (using all the actions a mouse and ...

supporting_websites.snippet: Operator uses a model called Computer-Using Agent (CUA), built on OpenAI o3 to interpret screenshots and interact with sites using typical browser controls like a cursor and mouse.

supporting_websites.title: OpenAI’s new Operator agent can use the web for you
supporting_websites.snippet: OpenAI is releasing a preview version of its first AI agent, Operator, which is specifically designed to use a web browser and can, for example, book a table at a restaurant for the user on its own.

content_references.matched_text: For developers interested in building applications utilizing the CUA model, OpenAI offers tools such as the **Responses API** and **Agents SDK**.
content_references.alt: For developers interested in building applications utilizing the CUA model, OpenAI offers tools such as the **Responses API** and **Agents SDK**.

content_references.matched_text: These tools facilitate the creation of AI agents capable of performing complex tasks across various digital environments.
content_references.alt: These tools facilitate the creation of AI agents capable of performing complex tasks across various digital environments.

items.title: New tools for building agents - OpenAI
items.snippet: These new tools streamline core agent logic, orchestration, and interactions, making it significantly easier for developers to get started with building agents. Over the coming weeks and months, we plan to release additional tools and capabilities to further simplify and accelerate building agentic applications on our platform.
